Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip interior: glazed black; exterior: part of two bands fired brown; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The concentric bands on the cul of chalices appear as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC. Williams, 1983, 162-3
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0716) (phase 2)
